website_summaries.verdict: Compatible with any Mac or PC, this corded headset comes at a high value, especially given how comfortable and functional it is.
pros: Operates via USB port, leaving headphone jack vacant
Volume controls and mute button are conveniently built into cord for easy access
Microphone can easily be tucked away when not in use
cons: Connects via cord, which could be a bit inconvenient at times

website_summaries.verdict: Ideal for office use. Can be used with a variety of applications and platforms, from Windows 2000 to the latest Mac OS.
pros: Work especially well with Skype, delivering clear VoIP calling
Clear sound quality separates bass and treble well
Volume control on left ear cup is easily accessible and has good noise cancellation
cons: Some users say Windows 7 didn't recognize the device, even though it's compatible, requiring reinstallation
Mic quality not much better than the one on a laptop

customer_reviews.title: Microphone component stopped working after just a couple of months :(
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I was going to give this 5 stars before today, but then the microphone stopped working! There doesn't appear to be any damage to it at all, but people can't hear me all of a sudden when I'm using it even though I can hear them. I'm very disappointed because before that this had been a total game-changer for me, especially since it was reasonably priced and lightweight. I haven't even had it for more than a couple months or so. :( Guess I'll have to buy a new one from a more expensive brand that had more positive reviews. I was looking forward to giving this one a boost for being so great until this happened, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Meadow

customer_reviews.title: Avoid Logitech
customer_reviews.text: I spent about 6 years of Stockholm syndrome trying to tell myself that this was good and it's just not. These things break on a yearly basis and the customer service people will always give you a worse headset than what you paid for. It has a few cool things like a mute button and comfortable mic placement, but spending $60 on a headset 6 times because it kept breaking can buy you a good quality headset instead. I've been using the HyperXCloud for about a 18 months now and the damn thing still functions. What a concept.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Headset is Destroying My Life
customer_reviews.text: I reordered the Logitech headset I had previously, but this is not the same headset. Out of the box, I could see this was a cheaper version and it performed atrociously. People often can't hear me, the sound quality on my side is poor, and the mute button randomly works. Which has been a nightmare when I need to press it quickly to mute, sometimes it works and sometimes not. Now people have been having a hard time hearing me and all of a sudden my sound cuts out and they can't hear me at all, I've been calling my clients from my cell phone. Very embarrassing. Looking for a new headset now, completely avoiding Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Caspersen

customer_reviews.title: Echos and Unmutes
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 6 weeks now. I would not recommend this headset. I use this for business conference calls at work. I have two complaints. People complain that they can hear themselves echo. The problem is the mic is too close to the ear. If you raise the mic up away from your ear or lower the volume the echo goes away. My second issue is that the mic unmutes itself without my knowledge. I thought it was user error (that I was just brushing against it). But I've been paying attention for a week now. Sometimes on long meetings it just unmutes without my knowledge. Not cool.
customer_reviews.author: S. Banks

customer_reviews.title: Can't really recommend. Ground loop humming on microphone. REVISED DOWN
customer_reviews.text: Can't really recommend this headset. The reason being that 1 of 2 laptops and 1 desktop suffer from the ground loop issue where there is a hum when using the microphone. Without being able to tell before hand if you will suffer from this issue, I cannot recommend. I have other headsets, 1 from Plantronics and 1 from Logitech that do not suffer from the ground loop issue on all these same devices. Must not have noticed on the other laptop or tested while it was plugged in and charging. If a devicve is plugged in the mic will create a hum, if running on battery no hum.
customer_reviews.author: biffsteele

customer_reviews.title: Good headset for small heads
customer_reviews.text: This is a good headset. Plugged into a Windows 10 computer and it set itself up. Works well with Microsoft Teams. Sound quality is excellent. I can’t hear myself but I believe the mic quality is really good. The wired connection is a bit of a pain but it keeps from Bluetooth drop-outs so I’ll take it. My only gripe is the comfort. My ears begin to hurt after about 10 minutes. I have to move the side with the mic in front of my ear and then it’s bearable but now the sound is mono and doesn’t sound as nice. For the price, I’d still recommend them. Just wish they were more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: loudpedal

customer_reviews.title: Very nice sound quality. Comfortable. Mic is a little too short.
customer_reviews.text: This is, for the most part, a great headset. Sound quality is great. Installation was simple - just plugged it into the USB. The noise cancelation doesn't seem very strong. When on a Zoom or Teams meeting, background noise on my end will "light up" the sound indicator for me - telling me the app is hearing the background noise. I haven't tested it specifically though. My only complaint is that the microphone boom is too short. It often rubs against my face / mouth - which I'm sure causes a rustling noise for others. I wish you could extend it.
customer_reviews.author: Waldo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: My husband asked for these headphones. Since working from home during this coronavirus he needed headphones for meetings with a mic. Sound quality is great. The stereo sound for music is also great. Headphones are adjustable and comfortable. Mic is easy to use flips up when not using it. Like the mute button on the cord for easy use.
customer_reviews.author: JLaswell

customer_reviews.title: Great price; great fidelity
customer_reviews.text: I'm using the headset for online meetings and they work great. Very light weight...I forget I have them on.... and very good fidelity. These are not for listening to a symphony orchestra (although I haven't tried) but I can hear everyone perfectly. It doesn't sound muffled or 'phone like'; lots of good voice fidelity. I wear them for 3-4 hours a day and I don't get a headache. They're so light weight that they don't 'squeeze' my head when I'm wearing them. The microphone picks up my voice easily. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: NYdirector

customer_reviews.title: Okay headphones, but uncomfortable and do not work with AppleScript on Mac.
customer_reviews.text: This headset works ok as far as sound quality and noise cancellation. However, it is very uncomfortable for me for whatever reason. They put too much pressure on the crown of my head and my earlobes. Also, I use AppleScript to control input volume instead of the inline controls since inline controls are sometimes unreliable. This headset DOES NOT WORK with AppleScript. Even if you set the input volume to zero, they still transmit noise which is unacceptable. I have requested a return and will look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: The Logitech headset is very crappy! They break easily. Very cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: Total pice of crap! Never lasted very long. Over time the fake leather on part that sits on the head wears off and falls apart. the Logitech headset is made with very crappy plastic. Buy Mpow, way better. Mpow has the ability to detach the headset from the USB port, then you can plug it in the head-phone jack on any phone computer or music device. We fight over the one Mpow headset at home. Now no one uses the Logitech crap any more. we love Mpow headsets! the Mpow headsets also have an adjustable, bendable mic, very nice!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Not the best quality but I guess it works
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 2 of these because the first one started having issues after a couple months. The speaker started to crackle, and people on the other side said they couldn't hear me correctly. This one is holding up so far, but I havent had it very long. They hurt to wear for more than a couple hours. I teach online and have to take them off in my 5 minute breaks between classes because my ears hurt. Best feature is the noise canceling mic to cut down on background noise, but it makes you sound very tinny, the sound is cheap. If you can afford a better pair, go for it- but if you're on a budget, this will do.
customer_reviews.author: JayWolfpack

customer_reviews.title: Not good for quality recording, but OK for gaming chats
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this headset to record a podcast with. I had previously bought a set that were EXCELLENT for the price, but are no longer available. We have a studio quality mic, but it has no headphones, and is combersome to use. So we wanted something that would replace the Koss headphones we had that were excellent for recording and listening, but are no longer available. So, my overall opinion is, if you want excellent recording capabilities, look elsewhere, if you are just gaming and want to chat with your gaming buddies this should do fine.
customer_reviews.author: F. Kosac

customer_reviews.title: Good while they lasted...  (less than 90 days)
customer_reviews.text: While the sound quality is pretty good, I did not like the volume control/mute button in the middle of the headphone cable... AND, just after 60 days I started getting complaints that my conversations were cutting out - if I move, even slightly, while talking on this headset, it cuts out. Save your money and buy something else. I really liked these... they were comfortable and felt like they were made well. But you need to get more than 90 days out of a purchase, I think.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Whaley

customer_reviews.title: good, but not great mic
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a headset for telecons, that had good microphone audio quality and noise cancelling mic. I compared it with 3 other headsets: MPOW 071 (bluetooth), Sennheiser PC 8 (wired), HyperX Cloud Revolver S (wired). Results weren't surprising - the bluetooth was miserable compared to the wired, and you get what you pay for, where the Sennheiser beat out the Logitech by a bit, and the HyperX was the best overall (sound and mic performance)
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty good. On one computer, during video conference the audio still plays through the computer and not the headphones. That may be a settings problem but maybe not (older iMac). Not sure. It seems really good for only detecting my voice instead of everything in the room like the computer mic might does. So that is basically....mission accomplished. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Good reliable headphones
customer_reviews.text: Have had this headset/microphone about a month and a half. Has worked fine. Very happy with them although I thought when I bought them they had a volume control setting, but there is only a button to turn audio on and off. Doesn't matter. Love the headset.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Breaks after a few months
customer_reviews.text: I liked the first one that I purchased, so when it broke, I gave it a second chance, but even after third, fourth and fifth chances, this thing literally breaks after just a couple of month. I've spent a ton of money on this many headsets and wish I had learned my lesson after the second one broke.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica L.

customer_reviews.title: Good for webinars
customer_reviews.text: My company started doing webinars instead of seminars when COVID hit. We ordered these headsets for all the panelists so we could be assured of good sound no matter what. A couple of tips: 1. plug in the headset before you start the webinar or there will be a slight delay between your lips moving and the sound coming out. 2. You can plug in the headset but choose to use computer audio by clicking the audio feature in your control panel and selecting the option that does NOT say USB. Then, if your audio goes south during the webinar, you can select the USB audio and put your headphones on to solve the problem.
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: Work Horse!
customer_reviews.text: Why spend hundreds on other headsets. This thing does the job and it does it right! I work with it and use it EVERY DAY. No complaints for the price paid.. I've even played some games and it's not terrible. Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but uncomfortable for long calls
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to replace a headset that only had the headphone piece for one ear since these have speakers for both ears. I was very surprised at how great the sound quality was especially since these aren't that expensive relative other options on the market. However, after about 45 minutes straight of use, my ears were very sore. There is too much tension between each side of these headphones for them to be comfortable for long periods of use; they pushed too much on my ears. When you look at these straight out of the box, the 2 ear pieces are practically touching each other. This was disappointing because the sound quality really is quite good.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Carter

customer_reviews.title: Worth it's price
customer_reviews.text: I picked it up on sale though.... I find that it squeezes a little on my ears, which makes it uncomfortable for really long sessions, but what really mattered most to me was having a good mic that would cancel out the background noise of my loud neighbors, so I could work professionally from home and not have my clients/co workers hearing anything other than my voice, and also that they hear it crystal clear. THAT it does perfectly, so I hope it lasts me a good long time.
customer_reviews.author: Boricuaguy

customer_reviews.title: Great for as long as it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Logitech ClearChat Comfort/USB Headset H390, Noise Cancelling Microphone I purchased on 10/26/2016. I am a big fan of Logitech products and have spent lot$ of money on them in the last 20 years. BUT! I'm watching a movie on my computer when the action starts and the movie volume cranks up. I pushed the control button on the chord that also mutes the microphone to turn the volume down. That was the last time I heard anything from the headset. It just died. Now I have to order a replacement. I'm not impressed and I don't think you will be either.
customer_reviews.author: Mortimer  snerd

customer_reviews.title: Ok for most applications
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with our company's voice over IP (browser based) phone solution. Microphone input was ok to poor most of the time with callers having difficulty hearing me. Product did work well with Microsoft Teams and GoToMeeting apps. But not for the application I primarily needed it for. Switched to a headset with 3.5mm connections (instead of USB) and that seems to be working better with my application.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's okay. There are better microphones for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a Wantek F600J35 noise-canceling headset and I wanted to switch over to a USB noise-canceling headset so I bought the Logitech H390. The sound quality is better than the built-in mic but there is a slight hiss still. The Wantek headset is much better for about the same price. So as long as you don't care about it using the headphone jack, I would recommend the Wantek over this headset.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: The absolute best work at home headset
customer_reviews.text: I was on the search for a long time for a good work at home headset. I am on the phone for a majority of my day, working at an online school. I tried many headsets - including big, bulky gamer headsets that were 'proven' to be comfortable and clear - all total BS. My biggest concerns were: -I have a big head -I wear glasses -Voice quality This headset kicks the heck out of headsets that are $100 more in comfort and sound quality. HyperX? SteelSeries? Ok lol, these outlasted those and sounded much better to both. my coworkers and my students. I like these so much I have 3 pair. Just get them.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sanko

customer_reviews.title: Fine and functional if you’re not picky.
customer_reviews.text: These worked well enough but I ultimately returned them. Pros: - they worked - they were easy to use - nice volume/mute functionality on the cord - long cord Cons for me: - didn’t fit well - slightly tinny sound - slipped off my head easily - felt as inexpensive as it was Fine and functional if you’re not picky.
customer_reviews.author: JaredPS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the money but...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are an excellent value for the money with great sound quality. While I kept them and use them I would not purchase again as I find them uncomfortable and I have ear pain after an hour or 2. They are just too tight on the ears with no adjustment option. It is difficult to purchase these type of products without being able to check a longer term fatigue factor.
customer_reviews.author: mpercib

customer_reviews.title: Really not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: This headset was recommended as adequate for guesting on other people's podcasts, and for Skype call recording. I sound WAY better with this set than with any earbud-style set with in-line mic. The mute button is reliable, though a bit far down the cord to be right at hand when I'm sitting down. They get slightly uncomfortable after a while on my big-giant head (hat size 7-7/8) over glasses, but they're good for an hour and half, anyway. The sound coming in is plenty clear for talking. Haven't tried them for music. Setup on a Windows 10 laptop was no problem. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hawley

customer_reviews.title: Works great for online teaching
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my online teaching and meetings. Works very well. Nice, long cord so I don't have to feel stuck to my computer. It is comfortable to wear; I have it on from 815-415 with only short breaks.
customer_reviews.author: CleverReviewName

customer_reviews.title: Light and tight fit but comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Logitech is one of my favorite office brands. I work from home as a teacher and I needed a reliable set of headphones with a mic. I still own my first set and they have lasted four years no problems. I decided to get a second pair as a back up. The only thing I noticed is that the cord does get twisted so I purchased a stand for them and that is no longer happening. The are worth the value price. I also gave one as a gift and the person likes them. Easy install no CD needed. Just plug it into the USB and you are ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Midwest Maddy

customer_reviews.title: The boom is always to your left.. This sucks
customer_reviews.text: This is not the dark ages nor the stone age nor bronze age. Headsets have been around for a while and anyone making them should know that not everyone likes the boom just on one side. This headphone forces the boom to your left. The product description does not call that out. It should It should be a warning bigger than the picture of the product itself. Who knew this would be an issue... I threw away the packaging. Now I need to see if I can return this crap. Bad product design logitech... This is just bad.
customer_reviews.author: whywhy

customer_reviews.title: Fine but a bit flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for the Logitech headset we bought three years ago. For the price I expected it last longer than two years before it started falling apart, but I guess that's too much to expect. I hope this one last longer before deteriorating but the ear pieces are already starting to get loose :/ Sound fine when it's new but it is most definitely not built to last very long.
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Would not repeat buy
customer_reviews.text: Pretty poor quality. I’ve owned it for 3-4 months now with only once a week usage & am very disappointed in the quality. Volume button needs to be clipped to you at all times to avoid accidentally muting the phone when talking to somebody or turning the volume down all the way so you can’t hear the other person. The cord between the headset & volume itself is weak & brittle. Even with clipping the volume button to your shirt the cord constantly intertwines itself and tangles which makes it weaker and causes sound problems for people you’re talking to. Would recommend searching other options.
customer_reviews.author: TBSG

customer_reviews.title: Quality, Comfort and Inexpensive!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband who was working from home full time now due to the pandemic and he has long daily meetings throughout most of the day. He tends to be a loud talker so I bought these so he could hear himself and and he didn’t need totalk loud or turn the volume up on his staff he was meeting with. He says they work well and they are not very expensive. There are some headphones that are not as bulky as these but he says they are comfortable and has no complaints. I also have no complaints because I don’t have to listen to the chatter of meetings all day long!
customer_reviews.author: Picky Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Works Great! Clear and good sound.
customer_reviews.text: This is really the first headset I have had in a long time but after one month of use I really like it. The listening sound is very clear and the mic works great. I use it to make video screen casts with audio of me talking during the screen cast. Very happy with the result as compared to using the laptop mic. I also use it to make phone calls through my laptop PC using Google voice program. Everyone on the other end of the call says the sound is fine and I have no problem hearing them. Having the volume and mute control on the wire is great and I am always using it!
customer_reviews.author: Edward G.

customer_reviews.title: Sound great and mic is good
customer_reviews.text: I’m a teleworkers so I’m on these a lot. Wanted something no-fail (cord) that was simple to use and did not cost a ton. These headphones are great. I get compliments all the time on my mic quality... some of my coworkers sound like they are talking next to a freight train, are in a tunnel, making high pitched scratching noises, and all kinds of crappy sound defective mic/headphone problems... don’t be that person. Get some decent wired headphones. Your coworkers will thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Cruiser77

customer_reviews.title: Simply outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this headset is awesome! Thank you, Amazon for same day, free Prime shipping! The sound quality is crisp and clear and the microphone filters out background noise. You also have a volume control and mute switch on this headset, something, you don't find with the cheep, mediocre, headset & you have a left & right ear piece, not one, as with many cheaper models. Oh, forgot to mention how comfortable this headset is! Great padding, for hours of use! Sure, you can purchase an inferior headset for 8, 9, 10 dollars, but allot is lacking from those headsets. Great buy for $20!
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit on the ears.
customer_reviews.text: Overall the headset works well. My main concern is how tight the headphones are on my ears. I don't have a huge head, and I am suffering painful earaches after a long day of teaching online. I've had other headsets that don't cause me this type of pain--still the price is reasonable and they get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Headset
customer_reviews.text: This headset is horrible. It sounds poorly in conference calls which is what it was purchased for. I got these to replace my cell phone earbuds. These sound worse both to the listener and the actual sound from others. I would not recommend these at all. Do they work, yes. Are they quality, comfortable or good sounding, NO...
customer_reviews.author: AdventureRider

customer_reviews.title: Decent headset.  Nothing Spectacular
customer_reviews.text: My wife hates headsets that go over her ears completely. She likes not filtering out all the noise of kids, animals, etc. so she can always be up on what is going on in the house while she is working at the computer. She also is hard on headsets and this one is an exact replacement for one that lasted several years. So they are durable to a point. Granted the usb plug is not damage proof so definitely be careful with it along with the ear pieces as those are the 2 main things that i've seen get damaged over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert Armour

customer_reviews.title: Great Headset -Stopped the Echo
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and affordable headset! It doesn't echo at all like my other headset, and the sound quality is fantastic. The headphones are actually pretty comfortable until you're on hour four of a DnD campaign and your party runs into yet ANOTHER pack of ghosts and your half-orc fighter isn't rolling well and you're sure your ears about to get absorbed into the sides of your head since your headphones have been on for so long. However, that's more user error than design, but yeah, if you're using these for a veeeery long time, your ears might start to ache a little.
customer_reviews.author: A. McK.

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Dragon Naturally Speaking
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use with Dragon Naturally Speaking on my PC. I noticed an immediate improvement in the accuracy. (I'm using Windows 10 and DNS Professional Individual.) As for comfort, yes, they do bother my ears a little after a couple of hours, but either they're stretching or I'm getting used to the way they feel. Since I rarely dictate more than 2-3 hours, this is not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: A reader in Southborough

customer_reviews.title: Works well When Using Zoom on a Laptop
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this headset for using Zoom video conferencing on my laptop. I can hear others clearly and they can hear me. I have not played with the volume control yet and I have things quite while on Zoom so I do not know if the noise cancellation. works. The headset does what I want so I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kidd

customer_reviews.title: It just doesn't fit right...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I feel like this headset is one of the worst I've ever used. Here are a list of the negative things about it: 1. The headset does not fit right. 2. The arm not the microphone is attached to is so stiff that when you attempt to move it up or down it moves the entire headset. 3. The clip on the volume control portion of the headset cord does not work on anything I have tried to clip it to. 4. The cord that leads from the headset to the volume control is very skinny and flimsy, I doubt it will hold up to the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: Katidid

customer_reviews.title: Home Office Essential!!
customer_reviews.text: My third pair; not the brands fault it is my third pair. I have been working from home for about twenty years and I am sort of rough and careless with my headsets. I think I sat on one pair and the second pair I stepped on or maybe sat on those too; who knows?? Anyway, besides my carelessness I have no complaints about these headset; It connects to the PC with out any setting up, the sound is crystal clear, the mic is clear. Since my dog loves to bark I need a good mute button, the mute is the best! I recommend for any home office or any office.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Heavy on my head. Otherwise ok.
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this headphones set for over a year now and it does the job, BUT it is too heavy. Any day when I have a lot of meetings and use it for extended periods of time, the top of my skull hurts. Literally hurts. I noticed it in the beginning but decided to keep it and give it a try. Well, I still use it every day. I would invest in a cordless set if I were to buy it now, because this long cord is also a pain. Overall will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Rico

customer_reviews.title: First Pair Lasted Five Years
customer_reviews.text: I've used these headphones almost daily for five years and then, the plastic broke. I'm not complaining. I'm telling you they lasted five years. That's outstanding. I'm not sure I have another piece of tech in or around my computers that has lasted as long (ok, a Dell laser printer that lasted about 9 years, but that thing was a tank). Yet, these are very inexpensive headphones. The sound quality is ok. The comfort is ok. The functionality with mute and volume control is excellent. You can find higher end headphones, but I doubt you'll find any that last as long.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Fritchey

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Would get again...
customer_reviews.text: This is the world we live in now...and I need to multi-task while I work at home. This is great for all my zoom meetings and sound is really good. The noise cancellation is pretty good, but I haven't really had to use this, as it hasn't been too noisy. Cord is perfect length and volume control is great. I think it's worth the buy! The only think I wish is that it could connect to my cell phone too but only has a USB connect. Could probably buy a converter piece.
customer_reviews.author: Vee

customer_reviews.title: Affordable USB Headset
customer_reviews.text: Since I'm working from home these days I realized my phone headphones are unreliable when on conference calls. I wanted something affordable and reliable. I've had Logitech products in the past and they are top notch quality so I decided to purchase this based on other reviews. The headphones were easy to setup to the laptop. They are comfortable. Sound quality is outstanding and the nice cancellation is spot on. Definitely worth the purchase. I may actually buy another set for when i am actually in the office. These are better than my Plantronics headset i have there.
customer_reviews.author: Jeto

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality at a Low Price
customer_reviews.text: I am using this head set/microphone for Google Voice web calls. I am really impressed by the sound quality and noise cancellation. I can hear my callers very clearly, and they can hear me just as well. It is also great to be hands free while talking on the phone. The set was completely plug and play: I just plugged it into on open USB port on the front of my computer and started making calls. Two things to note: (1) My use is not very demanding of sound quality, I would not use these for music. (2) When plugged into my computer, my computer speakers are silenced, so I do not leave it plugged in when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Months in, wiring is spotty
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Feel decent on the head (I have a large head and the are comfortable), and very adjustable. Mic stays well out of the way. Sound quality is good, as is noise-cancelling (can hear someone yell but blocks out ambient noise). The cord is long enough to allow some movement flexibility. Cons: The volume control on the cord makes the cord heavy and it hangs low, making it easy to snag on chairs, etc. The wiring isn't soldered strong - left ear is already losing sound quality intermittently.
customer_reviews.author: Fester

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable over long periods
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are great for several reasons. I work from home in an environment that isn't always completely quiet. The mic on these headphones picks up my voice and almost nothing else, so my coworkers don't have to deal with any background noise. It's also very handy when working in coffee shops or co-working spaces. The headband is quite adjustable, and this is key to tweaking the fit so that these stay comfortable. Once you adjust these to find your sweet spot, they are very easy to wear for a long time. I've bought two of these for myself and recommended to friends and co-workers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling work
customer_reviews.text: Overall, great value and sturdy quality. Not too bulky so can take when traveling (but could use a slim down/lighter version). Mostly, it's a reliable USB wired headset that is simple plug-n-play. Ear cushions could stand to be a little softer, but they're comfortable enough to wear a few hours at a time. The headband piece also doesn't squish my head nor give me a headache. I had tried a bunch of the 'gamer' economic headphones but they were super bulky and the microphones weren't good. This one sounds clear to listeners and the mic adjusts more easily. Plus incoming sound is clear as well.
customer_reviews.author: devyn

customer_reviews.title: These are the best for the money!  They were the best price for the $$$
customer_reviews.text: I use them for both work and play. I never have complaints from customers regarding noise or any difficulty hearing or understanding me. I have been using these for almost 4 years now and happy to find them here for less than at Wal-mart or Best Buy. Update: This still stands up nicely and only tripping on the extremely long cord causes problems. My only complaint now is with the COVID 19 issues, the price on these went from $24.99 to $39.99 and that was very disappointing. I will have to seek a different headset as no one can tolerate that kind of price increase in the face of all the work from home agents.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what's expected but really uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this headset on my Cisco 8861 phone that I use at home and have been using it for 6-7 hours a day while taking a training class. I'm happy with the cushions on the ears and the sound quality but the headset band is super uncomfortable. I have a small head and it's digging in to the top of my head badly. I also wear reading glasses and the headset pushes them into my ears and head as well so I kind of tilt them so they don't sit exactly where they should. The headset is doing what it was intended for but it definitely doesn't feel great, especially for these long lengths of time.
customer_reviews.author: Hlizmarie

customer_reviews.title: Pros and Cons
customer_reviews.text: Pros: long cord allows movement. It is comfortable to wear. Connected volume/mute button easy to access and use. Sound quality is great with wide volume range Cons: the mic boom is not adjustable and sometime people have a difficult time hearing me. I feel like this could be resolved if I could move the mic closer to my mouth. Also, the mic boom does not turn 360 degrees so I am unable to put the mic on my right side instead of my left, which in my office would be preferable.
customer_reviews.author: Meams

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for Price
customer_reviews.text: The Logitech H390 headphones function as advertised. However, these are light-duty headphones and the sound quality is only passable. These are great for video conferencing or to listen to newscasts. Ear pads are fairly small so they sit atop the ear rather than cover the ear. They're easy to position to get optimal sound but they're not remarkably comfortable to wear for long periods of time. These are also not for music lovers or customers that want exceptional sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not the same quality as before
customer_reviews.text: I used these headphones a while back and was awesome for even gaming. Not sure what happened but the sound quality definitely took a hit. It's no longer very clear and not even the Mic and people's voices are very clear which was the perk of this headset before. Overall, this decent headset became a cheap headset that lost all the quality it had before. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Starian

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good headphones
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for about a month so far, but not everyday. They travel well and outlasted the last headphones I bought (which worked for about a day! Yikes!) They definitely work well, but the only thing I don't like is that after having them on your ears for about an hour you start to get a bit sore from the headphones pressing.. at least I do, maybe I have sensitive ears. Also, sometimes I wish the volume could go a little higher. But in general.. they get the job done. I don't need fancy shmancy ones, I just need them to continuously work well.
customer_reviews.author: Maren Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck, but still flawed
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, conversations on it usually go well, good sound quality (even for music), with plug and play simplicity. To suggest that it is noise cancelling seems unlikely. Even if it is, everyone around me can hear whatever is coming out of the earpads, so not ideal for an open office environment. Also I sometimes have to unplug it and plug it back in before it works (on multiple PCs). Also I find the volume control nearly impossible to use, but I have pretty big fingers. So it's a bargain, but there are reasons for it.
customer_reviews.author: Philip D. Mariconda

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should, not real comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a replacement USB headset for video conferencing. This one works very well technically, with clear loud sound. People report my transmitted audio is good. There is a mute button on the cord at waist level. I do not find the headset very comfortable; these are on-the-ear phones. I wanted a over-the-ear set but I needed a replacement quickly and this set does work well technically. I continue to use them to this day.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome Whelan

customer_reviews.title: I give up on Logitech
customer_reviews.text: LONG story, but Logitech continues to disappoint me. With this product specifically, it performs exactly like every other device I've owned that uses tiny flat ribbon copper for its cables... it wears out far too quickly. The USB connector itself is prone to damage, as is the volume control. If you anticipate replacing this every few months, you'll not be disappointed in the performance of this headset. If you're expecting noise cancellation... forget it. I hadn't even noticed that Logitech claimed this feature until I came back to write a review. Any noise cancellation is not noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Great Headset
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money. Very comfortable. I can wear this for a few hours at a time. The sound quality from the headphones is great. The noise cancelling on the mic is also great. My only complaint (and the reason for the 4 instead of 5 stars) is that the microphone only rotates 1 direction. Because of this, the mic always has to be on your left side. It would be nice if it rotated both directions, allowing the mic to be moved to the right side as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jim M.

customer_reviews.title: Hands free for teaching and gaming
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for online teaching. Great sound quality going both ways, plug and play, comfortable. Plugs into standard USB port. Super buy for my purposes!
customer_reviews.author: Scott VanDeman

customer_reviews.title: My daily driver
customer_reviews.text: Great headset for daily use. I work in technical support, and I use this headset every day for 8+ hours. Setup was a breeze on an iMac 2015. Plug it in, set as your default input/output devices, and start using. The volume control and mute button are nicely located, the status light blinks when muted and is solid when unmuted, sound quality is fantastic, and the mic picks up audio flawlessly. Build quality is exactly what I expect from Logitech. If I ever have to buy a new headset again, I'll be going with this one!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: great for video-conferencing on a Mac
customer_reviews.text: This inexpensive headset works out of the box on Mac OS and Linux (probably Windows too). The boom mic really works well in a noisy office environment and makes for far better audio/video collaboration than trying to use the built-in mic on a Macbook (which picks up every sound in the room). This headset even works well when 2 members of the team are sitting next to each other on the same conference call. No feedback or cross-talk issues. The headset is light and headphone quality, while not audiophile by any means, is decent enough to listen to music. The cable is long enough that you can move around and includes controls to adjust volume and mute the headset.
customer_reviews.author: tony mancill

customer_reviews.title: Worked well at first
customer_reviews.text: Got these as I recently started working from home and am on the phone a lot. These worked very well for a few months, all of a sudden I'm having feedback issues and my computer doesn't seem to recognize the input all the time. Have to fiddle with my volume controls between meeting applications. Tried an old headset today and no issues, except garbage sound (which is why I bought these!) - on the hunt again.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Pro quality and comfortable too
customer_reviews.text: I work from home and I'm in a lot of conference calls. these are fantastic. I went through two pairs of cheaper ones before getting these, and I wish had bought them sooner. The cable is super long, which is nice. The volume and mute buttons are in an easy place to reach. The Mic is easily adjusted to the right position, and doesn't pick up much sound from in front of me. And they are comfortable to wear for long periods of time. In addition, every computer knows what they are without my having to download drivers manually. Just plug it in and it works.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits the Bill for Work WebEx Calls
customer_reviews.text: I use these from home for WebEx calls. Everyone I've asked on the calls after I switched to these says they sound fine. Audio from the calls is fine. Previously, I had a set of open foam headsets which resulted in feedback from the earpieces to the mic if I had the audio up higher. The new Logitech H390 proved that the sound was not going through my ears from the ear pieces, into the hollow cavity between my ears, and out my constantly gaping mouth into the mic.
customer_reviews.author: Erik K.

customer_reviews.title: Cutting in and out when listening to chrome/firefox pandora
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I use this mainly for Teams meetings and sometimes for online streaming from Pandora but the sound cuts in and out every so often. Not sure if its the cable or my laptop but closing and reopening the browser times fix it, sometimes hitting volume up/down on keyboard works or maybe cause I am jingling it while I do it with my body that it reconnects on the actual device . Never the less, not that great of QC. LOGITECH if you are reading this, i need this RMA, thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Elias yah

customer_reviews.title: Good sound and audio
customer_reviews.text: This is a true USB headset and it works great. It is lightweight and the mic boom comes in nice and close. The cord is sufficiently long and has in-line controls that work well. The only negative is that it really clamps down with some pressure and my ears long to be free by the end of a work day - they are not comfortable but I am hoping that they gradually break in a bit. The comfort thing bugs me enough to remove a star from my rating.
customer_reviews.author: Art_dude

customer_reviews.title: Needs some improvements for comfort
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Once speaking to my computer, works easily. The microphone is clear, and easy to understand. Not bulky. Cons: My computer did not automatically connect this headset, I had to play with my settings to get it to work. They could be more comfortable sitting on my ears, but it's alright. Prolog usage of this headset does make my ears hurt. Not the most comfortable for long usage.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher Mom

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable fit, hurts my ears.
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality and mic quality are very good. I liked the smaller size, but in order for the noise cancellation to work properly, I have to have the cups all the way on my ears. This squeezes my ears, and I'm a tiny elf person who doesn't have an exceptionally large head. My ears were sore after wearing the headphones for less than one hour. I am returning these and buying some with over ear cups. I didn't want to have giant headphones as big as my face, but I'd prefer looking weird to feeling pain. I bought these for my zoom sessions (Elementary school teacher)
customer_reviews.author: Darla

customer_reviews.title: Kinda tight on the head
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. One for me and one for my wife and we both have issues with them being too tight on our head and ears. We can't wear them for long as they cause our ears to ache from the pressure being applied while wearing. I put my set over a box to stretch them out a bit. And that worked some. I need to do this more though. Otherwise they are a good product. Work as expected and the sound quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime C. Mantel

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best USB headset for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure there are much more expensive headsets, but for meetings, webinars, general gaming, or what not, these just can't be beat. My company kept sending me 1/8th inch headphone jack headsets, and even a set of (in-ear) Beats headphones. None worked as well for video conferencing. Noise cancellation is also so good that if you're on the phone you'll need to mention "hey I'm still here" every once in a while during quiet moments so they don't think you hung up or put them on hold. Great headset! Highly recommended for anyone using audio and/or video from their computer.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Duel

customer_reviews.title: Can you hear me now
customer_reviews.text: This is a great headset, albeit a little tight around the head. If I go back to back couple hours in meetings, my ears start begging for help. But the sound quality is great, incoming and outgoing. The mic that sticks out may not look too cool but does its job. Remember to mute on calls that may be too quiet as it tends to pickup sounds around you - like people hearing the ticking of my wall clock about 6 feet away. What's a wall clock you say?
customer_reviews.author: Vagabonds

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are fine for an inexpensive headphone, but I did not know the ear part does not cover your whole ear like others I have owned in the past. The ear cushions are just large enough to sit evenly with the edge of my ears, they do not completely encompass all of the ear like all the other headphones I have owned and I am not a freak with giant ears :P But these are fine for what I wanted for use on this second PC.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Microphone is bad
customer_reviews.text: This headset was purchased on August 7, 2017. It was not really used that much. But whenever I did use it I noticed the microphone volume was very low. I put them aside and moved on with other things. Today I attached them to attempt to determine why the microphone volume is so low. After researching on the web and then coming back to Amazon to look at the reviews again, there is a definite microphone issue with this headset. There are many complaints about the microphone. Now I am adding my negative review also. There is a general issue with the microphone and looking at the reviews the manufacture is not doing anything about it.
customer_reviews.author: JoanneP

customer_reviews.title: Best Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are the best I ever had. They cancel noise around you and have the best quality sound. I love to use these to listen to things when I do not want to listen to the TV someone is watching or other things going on. They are great
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great product-Recommend buy
customer_reviews.text: These headphones with mic are the best ones I have bought to date. I am an online professor. To speak using the mic and hear using the speakers, the headphones are very clear. I jump-up quickly several times and jerked the cable with my headphones and computer attached; and, the best part of it was the speakers and mic still work. I have had other headphones from different brands, and, when this happened, one speaker did not work. These Logitech headphones are very well-built. With a price of around USD 20, the headphones are an incredible deal!! Thx, Dr Kent.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Kent

customer_reviews.title: written by the wife
customer_reviews.text: I hate these. my husband spends more time playing video games since he got these because he says it sounds so realistic that he can hear which direction the enemy is coming from. but he cant hear me calling his name from 2 feet away..... wives don't let your husband bu this if you ever want to see them again. or if you want some alone time maybe get these as a present for them. up to you
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Silberstein

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: This head set is exactly what you pay for. I bought the extended warranty just in case, but these headsets are pretty good. I do not have complaints from my customers that they can hear the background noise anymore as well as they are comfy on my ears and cleanable. My one concern and the reason I will not be using the warranty when the break is they Un-mute when a call comes through. I have my phone on auto answer and don't always want my customers to hear what I am saying before I answer. Will not be purchasing in the future due to this feature.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa and Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Great headset for the price
customer_reviews.text: After reviewing several headsets online and then reading multiple reviews, I decided to purchase this headset because it was well priced and had all the features and functions I was looking for. I have used the headset multiple times for teleconferences, audio/visual presentations, customer phone calls, videos, etc. It is comfortable on my ears and I have not had one single problem with it. I would recommend this item to others. Overall wonderful product! Its lightweight and has a clear sound.
customer_reviews.author: Mary H

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancelling headphones
customer_reviews.text: Love these noise cancelling headphones. At this time in the pandemic, these are greatly needed to listen to Zoom meetings or Microsoft Teams. They really work for noise cancelling and you can be in the same room with someone else on the same call without hearing the buzzing and shrills of being too close to one another. Great value and really work nicely. Easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Merwin

customer_reviews.title: Massive static when on videocon and surfing simultaneously
customer_reviews.text: Love the heads but for one major, very strange problem: when I’m on a videocon and try to simultaneously visit websites, I get complete static! If I unplug the USB and then replug, it’s ok. A ridiculous problem that I never had with my old Logitech headphones. If anyone can explain and provide a fix, I’ll give these headphones a 5 star review!
customer_reviews.author: Chris C

customer_reviews.title: it was crap
customer_reviews.text: thought it was one of the apps i was using called bluejeans for group meetings. suddenly loud static. then the headphones stopped working. then i had to replug it in to fix problem. then it had to reinstall drivers. this went on for three weeks. i thought it was the app. then when i used it for skype and a doctor's telelvisit on another app the same thing. unfortunately i was one day late to return it for a refund. i told people it was a logitech and they laughed at me and said logitech sucks!
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Spearing

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, iffy fit (for my head/ears)
customer_reviews.text: The sound/mic quality is extremely clear and clean, so no complaints there. Two issues - The set is somewhat bulky and does not fold, thus taking up a lot of space in my laptop bag. The other issue is that it sits a bit tight on the ears, making it uncomfortable after a couple of hours. It's a little easier on the ears if I move the cups slightly forward, but then that lets external sounds in. That said, it could be the shape of my head, and you might not have this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mercury

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, but unacceptable mic
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that I had to return them, due to very poor mic quality. I tried them with Skype and Zoom on two different computers. In all cases, it sounded like I was talking into a tin can. I also would much prefer a wheel and switch for volume and mute. The toggle buttons don't seem practical. I found the headset very comfortable and the headphones are excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lady

customer_reviews.title: Good headset with microphone
customer_reviews.text: Good sound quality for listening to music or watching video with device, PC. This is for you if you are leery of brain damage or tumors from wireless headsets. Works very well for my listening and VOIP purposes. Good cord length to USB port.
customer_reviews.author: Serobi56

customer_reviews.title: earphones hardly used, but plug came apart
customer_reviews.text: I hardly used the earphones. I'd say about 40 hours of use. The entire usb plug came apart and is unfixable. The metal insert part of the usb plug came apart from the usb plastic plug covering. Completely useless and unfixable unless I cut off the entire usb plug and splice the wire to a new usb plug. Totally too expensive and work intensive. In short, lousy engineering, construction, and overall shoddy production.
customer_reviews.author: dl8ch

customer_reviews.title: clear crisp sound
customer_reviews.text: I use these for work and the sound comes in clearly and never breaks up. I speak softly, and these pick up my voice well. I hardly ever get asked to speak up. There's a few small complaints though. I have accidentally hit the mute function on the volume control which leads to customers thinking they've been hung up on. Also, while they are comfortable, they make my ears sore by the end of a long day. I think they push my glasses into my head a bit, and it just gets a bit sore. not a deal breaker, and otherwise they are great for my purposes
customer_reviews.author: Lisbeth shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Mic won't unmute
customer_reviews.text: I thought the product was great for the price. However, after 6 months of very light use I now cannot unmute my mic so I can't speak to anyone. This makes my headset useless and I can't find any information on how to fix this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Herold

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for teaching online
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to for teaching on line. The sound quality is amazing. I've had them for 9 months and use them daily. Still work perfectly. I have many headphones but this pair is my favorite. It never fails me. My ears do start to hurt after about 2 hours of teaching but I feel like that's any headphones that will do that. I love that I can mute the button and turn up the volume easily.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Hoornstra

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: I needed new headphones for a foreign language program. I asked my adult gamer son for help in choosing what I needed. He pointed me towards these for both price and quality. These are terrific. They rival my old Bose headphones in sound quality and are very comfortable to wear. Why did I ask my son? I've seen both he and my other son throw their headphones during game play. They go through too many headphones to count. I figured they'd know. They did.
customer_reviews.author: AZN8TV

customer_reviews.title: Microphone does not work
customer_reviews.text: I bought a set of these a few years ago (around 2015). I didn't use them for a while, and then when I tried to use them again last year, the mic had stopped working. I tried buying another pair in case the mic had just broken, but the mic on the new one doesn't work either. I have tried every possible way to troubleshoot the device on my PC, and nothing has worked. I can't find any answers online either. They all say to reinstall the drivers, as if that wasn't the first thing I tried. Logitech is garbage. I will be returning these and trying a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Surrounding noise cancellation not working
customer_reviews.text: So heres the thing: I bought this for my husband, solely because it said surrounding noise cancellation. In other words, I thought that the noise around the user would be cancelled out and the person at the other end wouldnt hear the background noise. It didnt work for us. Maybe were doing something wrong which is why I'm not totally tanking this review because the sound quality is still great. Cord length is fine and it fits perfectly well. Sound quality was great when we tested it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M Vichaidit

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, only lasted a month
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this headset for work for just under a month and have had nothing but issues with it. The microphone finally quit on me today. The sound quality is good if you only need to listen, but no one can hear me when I speak, or it comes across as a bunch of static. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: A. Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Great headset, great quality sound, flawed connector
customer_reviews.text: I love these headsets for their great sound quality and convenience, especially since I do daily video conference meetings. If the USB connector was smaller and of better construction, this would get that 5th star. Unfortunately, this is something like my 6th replacement set, because the extremely long USB dongle on it leads to easy breakage (the actual USB plug bends/breaks easily) and it makes it very hard to use in tight spaces because it is so long. I'm not an engineer, but it seems to me that they could move some of that electronics that's currently on the USB connector up to the mid-cord controller, or the actual headset, making the connector way smaller and more convenient/break-resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Parker

customer_reviews.title: It Stopped Working!
customer_reviews.text: This instance is my second time purchasing the H390. I purchased it a 2nd time because the first one worked excellent! My first time purchasing the Logitech H390 was from a different retailer and in person. My first H390 broke but still worked excellent! I taped it back together and had no problems other than the tape would not hold. So I decided to buy a replacement. I bought this one in August and in November it stopped working, the mic and volume stopped working! So dissappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Debra's Picks

product_meta.title: Logitech USB Headset H390 with Noise Cancelling Mic
product_meta.description: You’ll be comfortable with this headset thanks to the plush ear pads and padded headband that adjusts to you. The noise-canceling microphone cuts background noise-and rotates out of the way when you’re not using it. You’ve got it easy-this plug-and-play USB headset gives you quick access to volume and mute controls. Input impedance - 32 ohms.
feature_bullets: Padded headband and ear pads. Frequency response (Microphone): 100 hertz - 10 kilohertz
Rotating, noise canceling microphone. Sensitivity (headphone) 94 dBV/Pa +/ 3 dB. Sensitivity (microphone) 17 dBV/Pa +/ 4 dB
Convenient inline volume and mute controls
Advanced digital USB, connections: USB compatible (1.1 and 2.0)
Compatible with Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 10 or later and Mac OS X(10.2.8 or later)

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars12,478 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
